doc.field: Among the documents in this folder are three messages from Lady Astor(?) in London (1935-36); four silhouette drawings of people, identified by first name (1936); invitation to Independence Day event at the U.S. Ambassador to England's home (1936); admission ticket to the House of Lords (1936); programs at the Hotel Statler in Boston at which Frooks spoke (1936); admission ticket to the White House (1937); ticket and seating list for the 15th annual dinner of the American Law Institute (1937); invitation to Women World War Veterans luncheon, with note from Frooks to Lt. Holden (1937); silhouette of Frooks by Van Court (1937); newsletter "The Sandpiper" from the Hotel Traymore in Atlantic City, with image of Frooks in bathing suit (1937); and a Transradio News Feature with "news for women only" including an article on Frooks (1937).
